fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Given a holomorphic function f on an open set, it has derivatives of arbitrarily high order, given by the explicit formula f^{(n)}(z) = \frac {n!}{2 \pi i} \int _\gamma \frac {f(w)}{(w - z)^{n + 1}} \operatorname {d}\mathclose {w}, where \gamma is a circle around z contained in the open set.
